intro: Zygostates bradei, commonly known as the Brade's zygostates, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive floral structures. The plant typically features palmate leaves and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
